## Running Node-RED on Android

The [Termux](https://termux.com) app in the android app store makes it easy to run Node-RED on android devices. You can get it [here](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.termux&hl=en_GB).

Install it, and run it. Then at the prompt type

    apt update
    apt upgrade
    apt install coreutils nano nodejs
    npm install -g --unsafe-perm node-red
    node-red

Then you can point a browser to localhost:1880

#### Notes
 - You can npm install other node-red nodes such as `node-red-dashboard`.
 - The `volume-down` key is the ctrl key - so `vol-down-c` can be used to "break" a running app.
 - The instructions above also install the `nano` editor, as I find it useful for hacking files.
 - For a discussion on autostarting - see [this thread](https://github.com/termux/termux-app/issues/14) on the Termux Github project.
 - Likewise [here is a list](https://github.com/termux/termux-packages) of other useful Termux packages.
